DOC.detailed_description: To clinically evaluate treatment mandibular class II furcation defect enamel matrix derivative ( EMD ) and/or bone substitute graft make beta tricalcium phosphate/hydroxyapatite ( βTCP/HA ) . Forty-one patient , present mandibular class II buccal furcation defect , probe pocket depth ( PPD ) ≥ 4 mm bleeding probing , include . They randomly assign group : 1- EMD ( n = 13 ) ; 2- βTCP/HA ( n = 14 ) ; 3- EMD + βTCP/HA ( n = 14 ) . Relative gingival margin position ( RGMP ) , relative vertical horizontal attachment level ( RVCAL RHCAL ) PPD evaluate baseline 12 month . The mean horizontal clinical attachment level gain consider primary outcome variable .
DOC.criteria: Males female , 1875 year age ; Presence mandibular molar buccal classII furcation defect , present PD ≥ 4mm , bleed probe ( BOP ) , minimum ( < 1 mm ) gingival recession nonsurgical therapy ; Good general health ; Minimum interproximal bone loss ( < 2 mm ) . Pregnant lactating ; Required antibiotic premedication performance periodontal examination treatment ; Suffered systemic disease ( cardiovascular , pulmonary , liver , cerebral , diseases diabetes ) ; Had receive antibiotic treatment previous 3 month ; Were take longterm antiinflammatory drug ; Had receive course periodontal treatment within last 6 month ; Smokers .
